channel.title: Martial Arts
channel.description: I was wondering on what you guys though on it. I'm thinking about joining Tang Soo Do. Any of you guys have experience in martial arts?

item.title: Martial Arts
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Greeny:

The ability to kick the shit out of someone? (Muay Thai-I’ve seen people’s shins snapped straight in half) or just some good aerobic exercise (Kung-Fu is great) or maybe some self-defence (Judo?).

Judo is all about self-defense… I have done it a little bit, only the throws of it however - I had to learn them for Mixed Martial Arts, eventually I just enjoyed Muay Thai so much I decided to stick with that and BJJ.

Read full topic

item.title: Martial Arts
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

What do you want to gain from it?

The ability to kick the shit out of someone? (Muay Thai-I’ve seen people’s shins snapped straight in half) or just some good aerobic exercise (Kung-Fu is great) or maybe some self-defence (Judo?).

Personally I did Judo for several years but then had to quit because of my commitment to swimming.

Read full topic

item.title: Martial Arts
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

There’s no such thing as a martial art that sucks dick. Each and every one of them have both strengths and weaknesses.
I suppose you need to look at it from a particular viewpoint: do you want to do a martial art that is just that; an art? Or do you want to do a martial art that has fighting as its focus.

I’m sure that sounds funny, and someone will ask “what martial art doesn’t have fighting as the focus?”. For the record, tae kwon do (which I used to do) was focused on perfection of technique and patterns. A large emphasis was placed on patterns, which make up the artistic side of the sport.
I’m sure it isn’t like this at all tae kwon do dojos, but it was at mine.

You’ll find that muay thai, the one yz85racer mentioned, is quite good if you want an art with a focus on fighting. Unlike tae kwon do (and many others) they don’t limit themselves to just kicking/striking (tae kwon do), or predominately throwing (judo). Muay Thai makes use of 8 body parts for strikes (hands, feet, elbows, knees), something that can be very valuable, and something not found in quite a few arts (where elbow and knee strikes are often illegal sporting-wise; again, I’m speaking from a tae kwon do background when I say that).

Muay Thai is also one of several martial arts taught to police, security guards, military combatants and so on, simply due to the nature of the art (ie, it can easily be used offensively to quickly incapacitate someone).

Read full topic

item.title: Martial Arts
item.dc:creator: @Ramenryoko Ramenryoko
item.description:
@Ramenryoko wrote:

I’ve practiced Wado-Kai Karate, Jo-Jitsu, Bo-Jitsu, Tae Kwon Do, Defendo, and a few others over the past few years. Ever since I wrecked my knee though I’ve be unable to continue. : \

Read full topic

item.title: Martial Arts
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:9, topic:233641”]I know a bit of Muay Thai, but martial arts is for pussys
boxing is for men[/quote]
Boxing teaches you terrible habits, the biggest one I can remember is NEVER put weight on your front foot when throwing a punch. This leaves you vulnerable to a inside kick which would probably put you on the ground. It also teaches you to keep your feet way to wide apart, and lean into the punches. Big no, this leaves you vulnerable to a Judo throw, which if done right can end the fight instantly.

Martial Arts is not for pussies, I don’t see how it is - please elaborate.

I am sure if I was to go up against you (a boxer) I would most probably win, due to a Muay Thai fighters stance. That is the only dividend between the two fighting styles (I say fighting styles as boxing is not a Martial Art). Whilst most Martial Arts are jokes, e.g Karate, a few of them are extremely vicious and a lot faster than boxing.

Read full topic

item.title: Martial Arts
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“dragonfire455, post:7, topic:233641”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=308103.msg2463380#msg2463380 date=1222595380]

[quote author=dragonfire455 link=topic=308103.msg2463379#msg2463379 date=1222595122]

[quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=308103.msg2463376#msg2463376 date=1222594715]

Yes I have experience in Martial Arts. I do Muay Thai and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. Join a martial art which doesn’t suck dick.

I’m currently struggling in BJJ with the Peruvian Neck-tie choke, don’t know why but I always end up doing something wrong, I’ve been meaning to ask my instructor but keep forgetting l0l
[/quote]Did you say Tang Soo Do sucks dick, I’m just wondering.

Jiu-Jitsu? I’m impressed, never knew you did that

Yes, I do Jiu-Jitsu, and yes, I did say Tang Soo Do sucks dick.

Whilst we’re on the subject of Jiu-Jitsu, can someone find a good tutorial on the Peruvian Neck-tie choke? I put it in, but my opponent rolls over and gains side control and eventually armbar holds me.
[/quote]Why do you think it sucks dick though? And what else should I join

Join a full combat Martial Art - Muay Thai.

And, ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhh I see what I was doing wrong, I wasn’t stepping over the head of the opponent which in turn was not locking his arm in place.
[/quote]Maybe Kung-Fu? Basically because there’s a kung-fu academy nearby where I live. And they got loads of shit there, and the sense is an 8th degree[/quote]

Yz85Racer:

Join a martial art which doesn’t suck dick.

Read full topic
